intro: Allosorus greggii, commonly known as Gregg's ghostflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale pink to white, and it blooms in the spring or early summer. Allosorus greggii is a perennial species that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun.
